IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Metro Caring is Denver's frontline anti-hunger organization.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Metro Caring works with our community to meet people's immediate need for nutritious food while building a movement to address the root causes of hunger. Metro Caring and our community recognizes root causes of hunger as systemic issues that affects individuals and families' daily lives.
IRS990.Desc: Healthy Food Access: Our fresh-foods market is a take-what-you-need model grocery store where participants have access to a month's supply of groceries. Food is received through in-kind donations and through purchases.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ID Procurement: The organization processes requests for drivers licenses, birth certificates, and other identification documents.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Community Development: The organization pairs community members to connectors to assist their needs in a wholistic manner. It also helps community members generate wealth and keep it in the local economy with programs like the Mastermind Circle.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10 Other Income
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION - OTHER INCOME, COLUMN A - , COLUMN B - , COLUMN C - , COLUMN D - , COLUMN E - 65191.0, COLUMN F - 65191.0;

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XI, Line 2(d) Other revenues in audited financial statements not in form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Fundraising Event Expenses on Part VIII, line 8c - 39453

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XII, Line 2(d) Other expenses in audited financial statements not in form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Fundraising Event Expenses on Part VIII, line 8c - 39453

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Metro Caring works with individuals and families to meet their immediate need for nutritious food while also focusing on issues that promote long-term sustainability. Depending on the type of assistance and any applicable grant funding requirements, the organization may determine eligibility of individual recipients.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 7 Non-fixed payments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board Chair and Executive Committee approved nonfixed payments made in the form discretionary bonuses.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I Explanations of reporting method for number of contributions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Securities - Publicly traded - The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated. Food inventory - The number of contributions represent the number of pounds of inventory donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a Delegate broad authority to a committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization has an Executive Committee comprised of both CEOs, the Treasurer, Secretary and Board Chair. The Executive Committee functions between board meetings with the full authority of the Board, except on those matters restricted to the Board itself.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's top management. It is reviewed by the Board's finance committee and a final draft of the public copy with Schedule B redacted is reviewed by the full board prior to submission with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members and officers sign conflict of interest disclosures on annual basis. The forms are reviewed by the finance committee. If an individual has a conflict with a decision at hand, they are asked to refrain from deliberations and do not vote on the decision.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors engages an independent third party to provide comparable compensation data for non-profit employees in Colorado which is used as an aid in determining the compensation of the CEO and other officers. The independent members of the Board make the final decision on compensation packages of the top officers. Deliberations and decisions are documented in the Board minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: See response to Form 990, Part VI, line 15a.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's financial statements, conflict of interest policy, and governing documents are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 11d Other Miscellaneous Revenue
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Misc revenue - Total Revenue: 65191, Related or Exempt Function Revenue: , Unrelated Business Revenue: , Revenue Excluded from Tax Under Sections 512, 513, or 514: 65191;
